brief_summary.textblock:
A clinical study to determine the efficacy and safety of an investigational medication
      (MK0869) in the treatment of depression.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder With MK0869 (0869-060)(COMPLETED)

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is 8 weeks.

clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo- and Active-Controlled Acute and Extension Study of MK0869 in the Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: HAMD-17 total score at week 8. Tolerability.

reference.citation: Liu KS, Snavely DB, Ball WA, Lines CR, Reines SA, Potter WZ. Is bigger better for depression trials? J Psychiatr Res. 2008 Jul;42(8):622-30. Epub 2007 Sep 7.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.name_title: Vice President, Late Stage Development Group Leader

secondary_outcome.measure: CGI-I score at week 8, at least 50% reduction in the HAMD-17 total score, and Sheehan Disability Score at Week 8

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
